2316 | /*++++
2317 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2318 |  ** 									     **
2319 |  **   Function:		xdup						     **
2320 |  ** 									     **
2321 |  **   Description:	will return a string with 1 level of environment     **
2322 |  ** 			variables expanded. The limit is MOD_BUFSIZE.	     **
2323 |  ** 			An env.var. is denoted with either $name or ${name}  **
2324 |  **			\$ escapes the expansion and substitutes a '$' in    **
2325 |  **			its place.					     **
2326 |  ** 									     **
2327 |  **   First Edition:	2000/01/21	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2328 |  ** 									     **
2329 |  **   Parameters:	char	*string		Environment variable	     **
2330 |  ** 									     **
2331 |  **   Result:		char    *		An allocated string	     **
2332 |  ** 									     **
2333 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2334 |  ++++*/
2335 | 
2336 | 
2337 | char *xdup(char const *string) {
2338 | 	char *result = NULL;
2339 | 	char *dollarptr;
2340 | 
2341 | 	if (string == (char *)NULL) return result;
2342 | 
2343 | 	/** need to work from copy of string **/
2344 | 	if (((char *) NULL) == (result = stringer(NULL,0, string, NULL)))
2345 | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
2346 | 		return( (char*) NULL);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
2347 | 
2348 | 	/** check for '$' else just pass copy of it **/
2349 | 	if ((dollarptr = strchr(result, '$')) == (char *) NULL) {
2350 | 		return result;
2351 | 	} else {
2352 | 	/** found something **/
2353 | 		char const *envvar;
2354 | 		char  buffer[MOD_BUFSIZE];
2355 | 		char  oldbuffer[MOD_BUFSIZE];
2356 | 		size_t blen = 0;	/** running buffer length	**/
2357 | 		char *slashptr = result;/** where to continue parsing	**/
2358 | 		char  slashchr;		/** store slash char		**/
2359 | 		int   brace;		/** flag if ${name}		**/
2360 | 		pid_t pid;		/** the process id		**/
2361 | 
2362 | 		/** zero out buffers */
2363 | 		memset(   buffer, '\0', MOD_BUFSIZE);
2364 | 		memset(oldbuffer, '\0', MOD_BUFSIZE);
2365 | 
2366 | 		/** copy everything upto $ into old buffer **/
2367 | 		*dollarptr = '\0';
2368 | 		strncpy(oldbuffer, slashptr, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2369 | 		*dollarptr = '$';
2370 | 
2371 | 		while (dollarptr) {
2372 | 			if (*oldbuffer) strncpy(buffer, oldbuffer, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2373 | 			blen = strlen(buffer);
2374 | 
2375 | 			/** get the env.var. name **/
2376 | 			if (*(dollarptr + 1) == '{') {
2377 | 				brace = 1;
2378 | 				slashptr = strchr(dollarptr + 1, '}');
2379 | 			} else if (*(dollarptr + 1) == '$') {
2380 | 				slashptr = dollarptr + 2;
2381 | 			} else {
2382 | 				slashptr = dollarptr + 1
2383 | 					+ strcspn(dollarptr + 1,"/:$\\");
2384 | 				brace = 0;
2385 | 			}
2386 | 			if (*slashptr) {
2387 | 				slashchr = *slashptr;
2388 | 				*slashptr = '\0';
2389 | 			} else slashptr = (char *)NULL;
2390 | 
2391 | 			/** see if escaped **/
2392 | 			if ((result != dollarptr) && *(dollarptr - 1) == '\\') {
2393 | 				/** replace \ with 0 and copy rest of name **/
2394 | 				buffer[blen - 1] = '\0';
2395 | 				strncat(buffer, dollarptr, MOD_BUFSIZE-blen);
2396 | 				blen = strlen(buffer);
2397 | 				if(brace)
2398 | 					strncat(buffer,"}",MOD_BUFSIZE-blen-1);
2399 | 			} else {
2400 | 				if (! strcmp(dollarptr + 1 + brace, "$")) {
2401 | 					/** put in the process pid **/
2402 | 					pid = getpid();
2403 | 					sprintf(buffer + blen,"%ld",(long)pid);
2404 | 				} else {
2405 | 					/** get env.var. value **/
2406 | 					envvar = getenv(dollarptr + 1 + brace);
2407 | 
2408 | 					/** cat value to rest of string **/
2409 | 					if (envvar) strncat(buffer,envvar,
2410 | 						MOD_BUFSIZE-blen-1);
2411 | 				}
2412 | 			}
2413 | 			blen = strlen(buffer);
2414 | 
2415 | 			/** start at slashptr and find next $ **/
2416 | 			if (slashptr) {
2417 | 				*slashptr = slashchr;
2418 | 				dollarptr = strchr(slashptr, '$');
2419 | 				/** copy everything upto $ **/
2420 | 				if (dollarptr) *dollarptr = '\0';
2421 | 				strncat(buffer, slashptr + brace,
2422 | 					MOD_BUFSIZE -blen -1);
2423 | 				if (dollarptr) {
2424 | 					*dollarptr = '$';
2425 | 					strncpy(oldbuffer, buffer, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2426 | 				}
2427 | 			} else {		/** no more to show **/
2428 | 				dollarptr = (char *)NULL;
2429 | 			}
2430 | 		}
2431 | 		null_free((void *) &result);
2432 | 		return stringer(NULL,0, buffer, NULL);
2433 | 	}
2434 | 
2435 | } /** End of 'xdup' **/
2436 | 
2437 | /*++++
2438 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2439 |  ** 									     **
2440 |  **   Function:		xgetenv						     **
2441 |  ** 									     **
2442 |  **   Description:	will return an expanded environment variable.	     **
2443 |  ** 			However, it will only expand 1 level.		     **
2444 |  ** 			See xdup() for details.				     **
2445 |  ** 									     **
2446 |  **   First Edition:	2000/01/18	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2447 |  ** 									     **
2448 |  **   Parameters:	char	*var		Environment variable	     **
2449 |  ** 									     **
2450 |  **   Result:		char    *		An allocated string	     **
2451 |  ** 									     **

2453 |  ** 									     **
2454 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2455 |  ++++*/

2459 | 
2460 | 	if (var == (char *)NULL) return result;
2461 |

2466 | /*++++
2467 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2468 |  ** 									     **
2469 |  **   Function:		EscapeCshString(char* in,char* out)                  **
2470 |  ** 									     **
2471 |  **   Description:	will translate input string to escaped output string **
2472 |  **                     out must be allocated first                          **
2473 |  ** 									     **
2474 |  **   First Edition:	2002/04/10					     **
2475 |  ** 									     **
2476 |  **   Parameters:	char	*in		input            	     **
2477 |  **              	char	*out		output               	     **
2478 |  ** 									     **
2479 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2480 |  ** 									     **
2481 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2482 |  ++++*/
2483 | 
2484 | void EscapeCshString(const char* in,
2485 | 		     char* out) {
2486 |   
2487 |   for(;*in;in++) {
2488 |     if (*in == ' ' ||
2489 | 	*in == '\t'||
2490 | 	*in == '\\'||
2491 | 	*in == '{' ||
2492 | 	*in == '}' ||
2493 | 	*in == '|' ||
2494 | 	*in == '<' ||
2495 | 	*in == '>' ||
2496 | 	*in == '!' ||
2497 | 	*in == ';' ||
2498 | 	*in == '#' ||
2499 | 	*in == '$' ||
2500 | 	*in == '^' ||
2501 | 	*in == '&' ||
2502 | 	*in == '*' ||
2503 | 	*in == '\''||
2504 | 	*in == '"' ||
2505 | 	*in == '(' ||
2506 | 	*in == ')') {
2507 |       *out++ = '\\';
2508 |     }
2509 |     *out++ = *in;
2510 |   }
2511 |   *out = 0;
2512 | }
2513 |

2612 | /*++++
2613 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2614 |  ** 									     **
2615 |  **   Function:		ReturnValue					     **
2616 |  ** 									     **
2617 |  **   Description:	Handles the various possible return values	     **
2618 |  ** 									     **
2619 |  **   first edition:	2006/02/13	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2620 |  ** 									     **
2621 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp      *interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
2622 |  **			int		retval		Return value to check**
2623 |  ** 									     **
2624 |  **   Result:		EM_RetVal		Limited set		     **
2625 |  ** 									     **
2626 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_retval	set to N if "exit N"		     **
2627 |  ** 									     **
2628 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2629 |  ++++*/
2630 | 
2631 | 
2632 | EM_RetVal ReturnValue(Tcl_Interp *interp, int retval) {
2633 | 	EM_RetVal	 em_result;
2634 | 	char		*startp		= (char *) NULL,
2635 | 			*endp		= (char *) NULL;
2636 | 	const char 	*tstr;
2637 | 	int		 result;
2638 | 	static Tcl_RegExp	exit__expPtr,
2639 | 				break_expPtr,
2640 | 				continue_expPtr;
2641 | 
2642 | 	tstr = (const char *) TCL_RESULT(interp);
2643 | 
2644 | 	/* compile regular expression the first time through */
2645 | 	if (!exit__expPtr)
2646 | 		exit__expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, "^EXIT ([0-9]*)");
2647 | 
2648 | 	/*  result = "invoked \"break\" outside of a loop" */
2649 | 	if (!break_expPtr)
2650 | 		break_expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, ".*\"break\".*");
2651 | 
2652 | 	/*  result = "invoked \"continue\" outside of a loop" */
2653 | 	if (!continue_expPtr)
2654 | 		continue_expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, ".*\"continue\".*");
2655 | 
2656 | 	/* intercept any "EXIT N" first */
2657 | 	if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, exit__expPtr,
2658 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2659 | 		/* found 'EXIT' */
2660 | 		Tcl_RegExpRange(exit__expPtr, 1,
2661 | 			(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
2662 | 		if( startp != '\0')
2663 | 			result = atoi((const char *) startp);
2664 | 
2665 | 		g_retval = result;
2666 | 		em_result = EM_EXIT;
2667 | 
2668 | 	/* check for a break not within loop */
2669 | 	} else if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, break_expPtr,
2670 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2671 | 		em_result = EM_BREAK;
2672 | 
2673 | 	/* check for a continue not within loop */
2674 | 	} else if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, continue_expPtr,
2675 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2676 | 		em_result = EM_CONTINUE;
2677 | 
2678 | 	} else {
2679 | 		switch (retval) {
2680 | 		case TCL_OK:
2681 | 			em_result = EM_OK;
2682 | 			break;
2683 | 		case TCL_BREAK:
2684 | 			em_result = EM_BREAK;
2685 | 			break;
2686 | 		case TCL_CONTINUE:
2687 | 			em_result = EM_CONTINUE;
2688 | 			break;
2689 | 		case TCL_ERROR:
2690 | 		default:
2691 | 			em_result = EM_ERROR;
2692 | 			break;
2693 | 		}
2694 | 	}
2695 | 	return em_result;
2696 | } /** End of 'ReturnValue' **/
2697 | 
2698 | /*++++
2699 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2700 |  ** 									     **
2701 |  **   Function:		OutputExit					     **
2702 |  ** 									     **
2703 |  **   Description:	Outputs a 'test 0 = 1' line so command will eval     **
2704 |  ** 			with a non-zero	exit code			     **
2705 |  ** 									     **
2706 |  **   first edition:	2006/03/07	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2707 |  ** 									     **
2708 |  **   Parameters:	void			none			     **
2709 |  ** 									     **
2710 |  **   result:		void    		(nothing)		     **
2711 |  ** 									     **
2712 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_retval	if non-zero			     **
2713 |  **   			g_output	if non-zero			     **
2714 |  ** 									     **
2715 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2716 |  ++++*/
2717 | void OutputExit() {
2718 | 
2719 | 	if (shell_derelict == NULL) {
2720 | 		return;
2721 | 	} else if( !strcmp( shell_derelict, "csh")) {
2722 | 		/* OK shell derelict */
2723 | 	} else if( !strcmp( shell_derelict, "sh")) {
2724 | 		/* OK shell derelict */
2725 | 	} else {
2726 | 		return;
2727 | 	}
2728 | 	if (g_retval) {
2729 | 		fprintf( stdout, " test 0 = 1;");
2730 | 	}
2731 | } /** End of 'OutputExit' **/
